mechanoreception.notes: As sea sponges, Geodiidae likely possess basic mechanoreception to detect water currents and physical contact. This is inferred from general sponge biology.

chemoreception.notes: Chemoreception is likely used for feeding and detecting environmental cues. This is inferred from general sponge biology.

photoreception.notes: The presence of photoreceptors is unknown in Geodiidae. There is no evidence to support it in the provided context.
